metadata.title: CVE-2015-2238 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 4.1.0.21, as usedin Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76, allow attackers to cause a denial ofservice or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2238` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu1.1134').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
